intro: Mentzelia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Mentzelia latifolia is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it an important part of its native ecosystem.
